<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 386, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 361, 530]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 767, 560]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 604, 585]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 757, 600]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
The radioactive isotope bismuth-210 ( \(^{210}_{83}\mathrm {Bi})\) decays by \(\beta \)-particle emission to an isotope of polonium (Po).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 119, 144, 137]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 631, 137]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 141, 670, 170]]<|/det|>
\[^{210}_{83}\mathrm {Bi}\quad \rightarrow \quad \mathrm {^{....}Po}\quad +\quad \mathrm {^{....}B}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 196, 146, 214]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 920, 229]]<|/det|>
A radiation detector is placed on a bench in a laboratory where there are no artificial sources of radiation. The detector is switched on.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 242, 705, 260]]<|/det|>
In seven one-minute periods, the detector displays these readings.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[238, 273, 260, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>24</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[274, 273, 298, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>22</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 273, 343, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>25</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[353, 273, 378, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>25</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 273, 415, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>25</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 273, 445, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>21</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[565, 273, 590, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>20</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[595, 273, 620, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>24</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 305, 181, 323]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 304, 920, 338]]<|/det|>
Explain why, in the absence of any artificial source, there are readings on the detector. Suggest **one** origin of this effect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 444, 180, 462]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 444, 653, 462]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 504, 920, 521]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................................................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 534, 180, 552]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 534, 520, 552]]<|/det|>
The half-life of bismuth-210 is 5.0 days.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 551, 920, 584]]<|/det|>
A sample of bismuth-210 is brought close to the detector and in one minute, the reading displayed is 487. The equipment is left in the same place for exactly 10 days.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 597, 730, 615]]<|/det|>
Predict the reading in a one-minute period at the end of this time.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 768, 920, 787]]<|/det|>
<form>reading = .................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[843, 798, 920, 816]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 9]
